title: Good service
body: My telephone call was answered within 15 minutes and I got a same day appointment.  I only waited 10 minutes past my appointment time.  The GP treated me with courteously and In a professional manner. My prescription was issued the same day.

title: Great Practice
body: We moved to the Peartree Practice due to our previous practice not being fit for purpose. We have been so impressed with the Chessel Surgery (where we are registered), the staff are caring, friendly, kind and the service is very efficient. It is so refreshing compared to what we were used to and gives us much more confidence if we do need to contact our GP - thanks to all the staff!

title: Absolutely Diabolical
body: was told by a doctor to ring straight away if having breathing problems. When I rang was told by a woman who eventually answered the phone after half hour the doctors will not see patients any more was told to ring 111or 999, I asked would a doctor ring me back as I couldn't breathe and was told they won't do that either don't see the point in this being here but now the place is locked up and has been for a few days so it appears it is now closed down nice of them to let patients know .its a sad ending for what used to be a great family doctors.

title: Not so good
body:
When my wife and I first registered with this surgery we thought it was excellent. Unfortunately over the las few years it has gone down hill, and this is not because of COVID. 
We have noticed the change since some of the old doctors have left and been replaced.
We feel that we are being gaslighted, not being heard and the doctor making us feel like the problem we went in with is not there. Then we are doubting ourselves and checking symptoms on Google when we get home.
We also feel that the doctors are not experienced enough with the medical conditions which we have.
In all, not happy with the surgery at the moment.
At times we have connected with a certain doctor, but then the next visit we are totally disallussioned. Not getting direct answers about the condition we have gone in with.

title: Was given the wrong test results
body: I was asked to take water sample in which I did then rang for results was told every thing clear no action needed. A week later I received a phone call from a doctor saying I needed medication told her I was told everything clear also I contacted the surgery on the Wednesday for telephone appointment they would ring 10/12 the same day mini cal evening text telling the doctor hadn’t forgotten was asking another doctor for advice and would ring me back that call never came and the the doctor who rang me today 6 days later didn’t know why she was ringing me please get things sorted these are peoples lives u are playing with

title: Fantastic practice
body: My recent interactions with all the GP in the medical centre have been second to none great response times friendly and helpful would recommend to to all family friends and work colleagues. Even in the difficult times we have all faced they continue to give great service to all

title: Get appointment by ringing NHS111
body: No appointments, staff rude,  receptionist will diagnose you and it’s up to them if you need to be seen even though they are not medically trained!

title: going round in circles
body: i called the surgery hoping to arrange a non urgent appointment to discuss a couple of ongoing issues which have unfortunately worstened recently , i called in the afternoon as advised on your recoreded info (less busy time). I was 18th in the queue and waited 50mins for an answer, i was told that no non urgent appointments were available, it was not made clear what this actually meant, im sure its not forever so when would appointments be available?? i was then asked to make an e consult appointment , i said i didnt really want to do that hence making my call , i was told i could try again in the morning ,i said that calling in the morning was always much busier ,hence calling in the afternoon. (I think it would be a really good idea to advise incoming callers when all of your available appointments are taken either via website or on your answer message service,this would save your patients a lot of time,frustration and heartache) i said i would try doing an e consult as this seemed to be the only way forward, i was advised i could submit one between 17:00 and 18:30 this evening. i clicked on e consult at about 17:15 and got message telling me to submit my request after 08:00 tomorrow morning  !! more frustration. All i want to do is discuss the issues that are worrying me with a doctor, i am fully aware of the current situation so would be happy to have a telephone consultation even if that was in a week or two , this was not even offered as an option.I will try e consult tomorrow morning but i do not hold out much hope , i just find the whole situation very depressing im sorry to say

title: Unacceptable telephone wait times
body:
I was on hold today for an hour and 7 minutes to change an appointment that you automatically made for me despite notes being made to contact me before making the appointment. I was first in the queue 32 minutes in and remained first in the queue until I hung up at 1 hr 7 mins (5:32pm). 
I can only assume they had switched the phones off at 5:00pm however it’s not good enough that those already in queues are lost in transit with no communication. According to the automated voice message I was still first in the queue. 
With 2 young children it is hard to find the time to phone and wait half an hour to get to first position without waiting an additional 35 minutes to get no where and have to ring and endure the same thing again. It’s simply unacceptable that this service is provided

title: Appointment
body: I rang yesterday evening and I managed to get an appointment for the next day. I’m very happy with the surgery and the treatment I am getting. The reception staff are lovely and the doctors are so nice. Reading some of the comments I’m quite surprised to say that when I ring the surgery in the evenings someone always answers the phone and when I come in the evening as I work the doors always open. Surgery very good.

title: Very poor
body: Their website advises contacting a GP by filling out an online form and they will call you but the person that calls is not a GP at the practice.  Unbelievably deceptive behaviour from this practice.

title: Sick note
body: I asked for a sick note to carry on as of today as the one I have ran out today. I was told I would have it by end of practice. I am still waiting and now they have closed until 8.15am tomorrow. Not impressed with the service.

readBy.name: Plymouth University, BSc Nursing (Adult) 2021

title: Poor service
body: I never leave a review, but felt I had too, on the brink of leaving this practice, I have made numerous requests for follow up / phone calls etc, nothing .... if try to ring on hold for up to an hour, was asked to return for repeat bloods, no explanation, no follow up, asked for maintenence dose of a certain medication, was told they had left several messages regarding this ..... nothing progressed, was told the person didn't work this day or that day, on the whole poor service, never seem to have a problem resolved sick of ringing to ask, given up to be honest.  Will look into moving doctors as find dealing  this practice beyond frustrating.

title: Poor service
body: Waited over half an hour to have the appointment cancelled. Unable to rebook as it says no appointments available, check again tomorrow. Very poor service which leaves me worried for my health due to the length of time it will take me to get a referral.

title: Where are the doctors?
body: Medication review with pharmacist who was very nice and kind. Advised me to send in a blood pressure reading and book a blood test. I asked who my GP is as my GP had retired, but she couldn’t tell me. I tried to book blood test online but was unable, so rang surgery and was yet again in another queue. When finally getting through the receptionist couldn’t find if I needed a blood test, when eventually she could I was told I had to go to another surgery in next village because they don’t have anyone that can take bloods yet. I was told when I go for my blood test, in three weeks! They should be able to tell me.  The Deeping Practice used to be the beacon for all other practices, what has happened? It is shocking. It seems it is the only practice not having face to face consultations.

title: Good practice
body:
Medical staff knowledgeable, involved me, approachable good examination skill of sensitive area. Very happy with outcome and fast referral where needed. Only downside is length time in
 telephone queue, upto 30 minutes at chargeable rate. Must be improved to no more than 5-10 minutes.

title: excellent service
body:
whenever we called the response was quick 
first appointment is made on phone with doctor 
 and within one hour call received from a doctor
who in very detail  examined over phone and
prescribed the medicines.
Very recently a doctor called in an hour and 
examined in detail to my wife and sent prescription
immediately sent to our pharmacy .
Nurses always promptly administer B12 injection
and give themselves next due appointment from the computer.

title: Always get an appointment if some sort & help
body: I just want to thank Battersea Rise Group Practice as I have been registered here for over 15 years and I have always been able to get help when really needed it. Whether it’s a call back from doctor or appointment. There have been so many people saying they can’t get a doctors appointment for months and I just want to thank the surgery. Telephone appointments are brilliant as saves time having to go for some things for both them and me. Reception staff are a lot more friendly now too I have noticed which makes a huge difference. So a big thank you to everyone there for all your efforts in these tough times, it is really appreciated

title: Best experience with this gp practice
body: Amazing GP that offers range of appointments and tries best with patients knowing the NHS is under pressure. My recent experiences with the forest practice was stellar, I cannot fault them for the valued service they provided me with. Not only was they  considerable but also expedite when ı needed help. I cannot speak highly enough as my topic was quite a sensitive one. Thank you very very much for making the visit i had a pleasure but you also made me leave with a smile on my face as im so very happy with the gentleman on your front decor.  From going ın for my appointment he also  made the atmosphere clean whilst still being able to deal with other patients and protect everyone around. Well done

title: Fantastic practice
body: After reading some other reviews I’m quite shocked I have never had a problem with any staff members and have always had brilliant interactions with all of the drs or nurses I have seen or spoken too via phone I do find the e consult a bit long winded but in this day and age it’s necessary I always get a timely response and I would just like to point out if you are physically and mentally capable of filling out your own e consult leave the receptionists alone to do their actual jobs I have had to call due to issues with e consult question wise and have always received help so thanks to all who work there

title: Greatful
body: I rang a few days ago in the evening as I had Covid needed help I’m getting a sicknote. As soon as I rang somebody answered straight away she was very helpful very courteous and explain the whole procedure. She sent me the link via text message my phone was not working I rang back Four times and four times the young lady answered straight away in the evening. I asked her to emailed me the link which started to work. I find this fantastic service as I could not leave the house due to having Covid . She what is a very patient and did not get annoyed or angry as I kept ringing back because of the issue I was having with the link. The doctors are really good. I cannot fault the receptionist they do a fantastic job. My appointments are always in the evening and when I come it’s all open so I don’t understand when people say the doors are shut and nobody answers the phone because on Monday around four times in the evening and four times it was answered straight away My query was dealt with while I was on the phone. I would definitely recommend this surgery to everyone because They nothing but caring Surgery they go out the way to help me and I’m very much grateful. Thank you to all the staff.

title: Happy with my consultation
body: My husband attended a consultation at hospital last week after waiting 17/18 months. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The experience was very well organised and he was made to feel welcome. He had xrays to establish if his hip had deteriorated of which it had and was told he definitely needs a total hip replacement. Everything was fully explained to what would happen and given a booklet to read. Thankyou to the consultant and staff members. We are now just hoping the wait for surgery is not too long and he can get his life back to normality and get rid of the awful pain.

author: Zebrarc84
authorRole: the patient
title: Poor experience at my GP practice
body:
I phoned my GP practice for an appointment to let them see a boil on my ear lobe. When I got there the GP started giving me exercises for my knee. I explained I wanted my ear looking at. They then took a hissy fit, jumping about in front of me and waving their arms, saying they didn't have time for this, and that they were covering for another practice about 3 miles away.  
I showed them my ear lobe and they said they would refer me. It has put me off going to my practice now.  
I believe they were a locum but if I am really ill I'll be going to A & E. We used to have a good practice.

readBy.name: NHS Fife

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A little bit cold
body: So far I have been enjoying my time in the hospital. The nurses and doctors are all lovely. They have some very good staff, especially Grace and Darren – they are excellent. A lot of the staff go out of their way to help you and they really try to do their very best. The hospital is also very clean and tidy which I appreciate. It is a bit cold but I’ve already mentioned this to the nurses who have said there is nothing they can do to control the heating. The food however is atrocious – you could not pay me to eat it. The only thing I am able to eat is the breakfast in the morning, and I’m pretty sure that’s only because you have to be especially bad to mess up breakfast.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Couldn't fault the care provided
body:
After my daughter developed an infection, I brought her into Daisy Hill Hospital's Emergency Department. Everything was brilliant in A&E and all the staff were absolutely lovely.  
Up on the Daisy Children's Ward it has again been brilliant - I really couldn't fault it. The staff have all been absolutely brilliant. Every member of staff has had a very positive and welcoming attitude. Their communication with me has also been very good.  
The side-room itself on the ward has been excellent. I have no suggestions for improvement - everything has been brilliant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: skypp64
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A Wonderful Delivery
body: I was brought up to the hospital on Thursday night at around 10. I had gone into the stages of early labour at home. My experience was very dramatic. Honestly it was a bit of a whirlwind. I was in natural labour for approximately twenty four hours before my doctors and I decided that it would be best to undergo a Caesarean section. The doctors and midwives have been fabulous through the entire process. The staff made sure to explain everything to me, they honestly could not do anything better -all of them are amazing. Especially the staff in the delivery suite the care has been top notch. The food is ok also. I have been enjoying the privacy of having a sec room all to myself.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: saturnsz66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: So relaxing
body:
I came into hospital the other week as I had noticed that I had started to have contractions. I came into the assessment unit, where I was taken in and given gas and air immediately, I was then brought up to the labour ward where two lovely nurses, Mairead and Ann gave me such good advice. Due to my previous pregnancy I was told that for any future pregnancies l would need a caesarean due to my anatomy. Ann and Mairead said that if I did in fact need to be sectioned that they would ensure it happened.  
This was perfect as I feel that there are times when it feels like the nurses do not want to advise or promote caesarean sections. Since being moved to the ward everything has been unbelievably good. The staff have been brilliant helping me to look after my baby - I haven't had to worry about a thing since coming in. All of them are amazing especially the day staff who were on yesterday. It has actually been quite a relaxing experience which I did not expect. Everything has been quite simply amazing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Funky68
authorRole: the patient
title: When I was diagnosed with HIV
body: I was diagnosed with having HIV after suffering severe headaches. At first they thought it was some form of tumour but after finding some anomalies in my blood tests I was advised to go for a HIV Test. I had a feeling that the test would be positive but was relieved it wasn’t a tumour .

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Heacn63
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Amazing staff
body: My daughter had a skin tag on her belly and it was getting bigger and bigger and catching her clothes and she was becoming really self conscious about it so wanted it removed. She went into to hospital to get it removed. The two nurses were amazing with her so thank you, Kirsty and Angela. She is only young and was so nervous to get it done but they kept her chatting and were very caring and she was over moon once the procedure was done.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A beautiful ward experience
body:
All I can say about my experience here on the Stroke and Rehab ward at Daisy Hill Hospital is that it has been beautiful. Everything really has been absolutely 100% on the ward - I really have no complaints.  
The staff have all been brilliant throughout my stay here. I cannot single anybody out in particular as every single one of them has been so good to me. The communication from staff members has been very good. The attitude of staff members has also been excellent.  
When it comes to food it has been absolutely beautiful as well - I really couldn't complain about it.  
I honestly have no suggestions for improvement - I am overall very very happy with my experience within this service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Kind Staff
body:
I was brought in a few times over the past few weeks. I haven’t minded coming in and out of the hospital. The doctors and nurses are all excellent and they do their very best for all of their patients. They really care about everyone they treat, along with their family members.  
The food is good but it could be better, the ward is also quite good. It can be a bit disheartening with having confused patients on the ward but the lady opposite me keeps me in craic.  
Overall my time in hospital has been very positive. Thank you daisy hill

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My time has been grand so far
body:
I have been on the Stroke and Rehab ward at Daisy Hill Hospital for a couple of weeks now, having spent some time in Craigavon as well. My experience has been grand so far.  
All the staff members have been extremely good to me. They are all excellent at communicating with you as well. The only thing that is annoying is that it is so very boring here on the ward and I have nothing to do.  
Any food I have had whilst here has been excellent - it really could not have been any nicer.  
Overall my time here has been grand and I am looking forward to getting home soon.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Brilliant NHS!
body:
I am writing to express our sincere gratitude for our experience today in the testing department of ENT. My husband had attended for further tests following an acute vertigo episode. His clinician, was so lovely! Her history taking was thorough, explanations really clear and understandable, and the testing she carried out enabled her to identify a vestibular issue which, after more than seven weeks of dizziness was really difficult for my husband to deal with. He is now feeling more positive about the way forward and even more determined to make steady improvements. So, our heartfelt thanks to our amazing clinician. ( I would like to have named her, but was not able to do so due to hospital policy) 
All this , after a slow start following him attending A&E, when it became evident that his review appointment had not been arranged. Our thanks to the Appointments Hotline staff for ensuring that this was rectified. Well done NHS!!

title: Great staff on Sherbourne short stay
body: My partner was in short stay ward from the to Monday the staff was all excellent and worked so hard he was really looked after by all the staff thankyou  so much

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant experience in both hospitals
body:
I have been in hospital for a while now. I spent 6 weeks in Craigavon on 1 South. It was absolutely grand here - brilliant in fact. All the staff on 1 South were absolutely fantastic.  
I was then readmitted onto the Male Medical Ward here at Daisy Hill Hospital. Everything has been great here as well. The staff have all been absolutely brilliant. Their communication with me has been very good, as has their attitude. I cannot single anybody out in particular as they have all been so good.  
The ward itself has been comfortable enough for me. The only issue is that the blind next to me has been unable to be opened so I am unable to see out the window. I have mentioned this to staff however a pole is needed to do this and nobody is able to get one.  
When it comes to the food I'm probably not the best person to ask - my appetite just hasn't been the best recently and so the food just hasn't been right for me.  
Other than the blind mentioned above, I have no suggestions for improvement - everything has been so far so good at Daisy Hill.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful
body: Always met with kind patient professional staff who go above and beyond to ensure my psychological and physical equilibrium

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything has been grand except the noise
body:
I came to the Emergency Department at Daisy Hill Hospital after collapsing. My experience in A&E was ok and all the staff were grand.  
I was then transferred up to the Male Medical Ward. Everything has been grand up here except for the noise on the ward, especially from other patients. All the staff members have been grand and their communication with me has been alright.  
Any food I have had has been absolutely grand.  
As I have mentioned, the only improvement I can think of would be if there could be less interference and noise on the ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Attended Hanover Endoscopy
body: I went on Sunday the 7th August for an Endoscopy  & an Colonoscopy. The staff were fab & they took the time to explain everything to me. I was seen within 4 days of speaking to my GP. I was worried about it. These people who work for the NHS are wonderful. They really are.  All I can say is thank you NHS. Xx

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Couldn't ask for better
body:
My time on the Male Medical Ward at Daisy Hill hasn't been bad. The staff have all been very nice - I really could not ask for better care from them. The ward itself has been comfortable and clean.  
The food has been all good - however it has to be said some things have been nicer than others.  
I have no suggestions for improvement.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent  Physio experience
body: The  Practice i attended was very good, from reception to waiting room area every  detail for covid rules were  evident through out. My physio  listened to  me  explaining my issues then talked me through a excercise program she wanted me to follow, i had to log on to  Ascenti to input my excersises  which i had done.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: First class experience on Male Medical
body:
I came to Daisy Hill Hospital's Emergency Department after developing very low blood pressure. My experience in A&E was quite good. I was shifted about a bit as it was quite busy but that is to be expected. The staff were all absolutely brilliant however - I have no bad words to say about them.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has been absolutely first class. The staff have all been great - I really couldn't ask for better. Their communication has been first class and I try to do what they say.  
All the food has been absolutely brilliant.  
I have no suggestions for improvement - except that the wards are all so understaffed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mols555
authorRole: a relative
title: Smooth process to rearrange appointment
body: I had to re-arrange my daughters ENT appointment as we could no longer make it due to a conflicting appointment. I had a feeling of dread at the thought of contacting the hospital and trying to get through to the right department. However on ringing the main switchboard number and being asked to be put through to the  department it was no hassle at all. I was greeted by a lovely staff member on the main number then swiftly popped through to Outpatients and told which number to press on hearing the recorded message. A lovely staff member answered straight away, they were friendly & pleasant and quickly re-arranged our appointment with no fuss. Thanks you so much

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Receptionist was very welcoming and the nurse put me at ease and was quick & efficient . My appointment was on time & it is always easy to park .

title: Fantastic service
body: Took my 95 year old dad here when I visited him and found he had an extremely swollen inflamed hand, despite not going through 111 and getting an appointment time we were welcomed and dealt with very quickly - 50 minutes from walking in until we left with wound dressed and antibiotic prescription sent to our local pharmacy ! We need more places like this around the country, please keep up the good work!

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Doing ok
body: People are so quick to complain, but, I have always had a good service, diabetic nurses are very thorough and like the GPs very efficient.  Many thanks for taking good care of me...even if it takes a while...

author: charliecy79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been very good to me at every level of care
body:
Firstly I’d like to raise the point of a ward for sick patients with mental health issues. I feel it would help to have a team of specialist nurses looking after them as it would enable everyone to get the best care they can. I think the admissions system needs to change as you can have a patient admitted with alcohol problems and then discharged the next day to the home health care team.  
The staff have been very good to me at every level of care. They are all well trained and conscientious. The hospital itself is clean and well run. The staff are hands on and efficient. They are nice and capable and they do their best to make every patient feel comfortable. They are also able to have a laugh with patients and take time to speak with them. There is also a good variety of food, and there is as much or as little food as you want

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: No empathy or care
body: Came in with a suspected broken finger. After waiting 2 hours for x Ray results I recieved a call my brother in law had died. I asked the lead nurse if she could help out as if my finger wasn't broken I'd need to leave to be with my fiancee. Not only was she unsympathetic and was rude and condescending and said I'd need to choose between the results or my fiancee. She then turned her back on me and when I pleaded with her she said I can't tell you again now are you leaving or not. So I could have a potentially broken bone which I won't find out because I obviously had to prioritise a death in the family.

title: Waste of money
body:
I attend dialysis 3 times a week however I have been taught to do this myself. I am hindered by the hospital and Baxter stopping my progress and stopping from reducing there costs significantly by me doing dialysis at home. Staff are unable to provide dates for any equipment or plumbing work required for the house. 
This inefficiency is a massive waste of money that many patients go thorough.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Useless
body: Rang this morning and was told my problem with medication couldn't be sorted so the GP would call back between a certain time. Nobody called me. Rang them back later on and they said I was still on the list. It's now 10pm and still absolutely nothing! Ridiculous.

title: Fantastic Practice
body: I have been suffering severely with HG in early pregnancy. This week the GP’s and receptionists have all gone out of their way to get me seen or to have a phone consultation. One GP saw how distressed I was in reception and saw me there and then at the end of practice. A massive thank you to all the reception staff and the GP’s.

title: Stroke unit / ward110
body: A big thankyou to all the fantastic people who looked after me during my stroke.i have never met a more dedicated friendly and competent group of people.they were truly wonderful from arriving,paralysed down one side to walking out quite well with hopefully  no lasting defects.i really cannot thank this team enough and they are a credit to the trust and the nhs.one word..wonderful..

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great clinic in MK
body:
Staff were lovely, was seen to on time, if not early.
MRI was fully explained and 45 minute scan flew by.

author: romeomg63
authorRole: a service user
title: Unexpected few nights at Lincoln county hospital
body:
After a visit to our practice nurse in Market Rasen I was told to take my chest pain directly to the Lincoln SDEC without delay. I arrived, they knew I was coming, and without delay started tests, x-rays and bloods. In no time at all I was told I had a collapsed lung and needed an urgent drain in the chest. SDEC staff were brilliant explaining in basic terms what had happened and what was needed.  
I was taken to a bed in A&E where two young doctors prepped me for the drain explaining everything and being kind and considerate at all stages. With the drain in and pain killers administered I was admitted to the RSU where I was greeted by friendly and kind staff again who settled me down and answered my questions.  
Next day I was visited by the practitioner nurse and the consultant. They again introduced themselves and explained all had gone very well and that I was on course for a release in about another 24 hours. I was checked and made comfortable very regularly but in a way that did not cause me distress or concern. They were true to their word and following more checks and x rays I got home by 17:00 next day.  
I can't thank the team at Lincoln county enough. There are too many to name and I wish I could remember them all. I don't want to repeat the experience but if I had to, I would feel comfortable that the outcome would be as positive as this. Thank you Lincoln county staff, you are all stars!!

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Top Class
body: I have been seeing my doctor for the past few weeks due to having low sodium levels. I have been having bloods done weekly at the minute. I received a phone call, stating that my liver enzymes or something were elevated. I was told to go up to the hospital straight away. This was last week. My time in the emergency department was alright, I managed to get a bed down in the ED while I waited for a bed on the ward. On the ward everything has been good. The doctors and nurses are amazing as is the food. I’m supposed to be having a procedure done this week and due to that my diet has been changed and I am only able to eat certain foods. This is normally fine, however there have been occasions where I have received food that is not on the list of food that I can eat at the minute which is frustrating when I try and explain to some of the nurses about this. There are also times where I feel like I am having to relay all of my information to different nurses only for them to say that they’ll check my notes to see if what I have told them is correct but then they come back and agree with what I have said. Aside from this inconsistency in communication and food, everything has been brilliant and the care I have received has been top class

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Poor triage process and GP experience
body: I filled in the online form to report an issue with my knee. I was given an appointment with a GP, possibly a locum as I hadn't met him before. The doctor didn't touch nor look at my knee. I'd even put on a pair of shorts to make an examination easier. His comment was; I'm paraphrasing, that he couldn't do anything about it and that he'd refer me to a physiotherapist at the Cumberland Infirmary. I later learned that the Cumberland Infirmary had a 10 month waiting list when I could have seen a physio within 3 weeks at the doctors' surgery itself. In essence the triage system sent me to the wrong person, the doctor wasn't interested and I was referred to a service which would see me in 10 months rather than 3 weeks.

title: Poor management
body: I’m very disappointed with the care and efficiency of the service at Sandwell utc and paediatric department. I bought my 13 year old son to be seen as 111 referred him there. He was vomiting constantly and almost fell after using the loo as he was feeling very dizzy and he pressed the emergency button but no staff came so I walked him out slowly from the loo and saw them in the corridor. All they were concerned was about how to stop the noise from the emergency buzzer. I was then sent to the paediatric department waiting for several hours before the doctor was anywhere to be seen. I came in with my son at 4.45 and doctor saw my son at 11.30 and waited further 4 hours for blood results. Staff are under trained. My son was left hungry from 4.45pm. The management of the hospital is appalling. Staff at the UTC sandwell are rude. As I came into the car park. I spotted a car park space, however a staff from the utc decided to stand in the bay so I don’t park there and she refused to move as I reversing, I then realised she was standing there so her colleague can park. I was left to park very far and it made it difficult for my son to walk as he was feeling dizzy. They both ignored the fact I was attending the utc. I am very disappointed with the mistreatment.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I really cannot think of any suggestions for improvement
body:
My Daisy Hill Hospital experience began in the Emergency Department. I had quite a long wait but all the staff were absolutely brilliant.  
I was then moved up to the Male Medical Ward where it has been absolutely perfect. All the staff have been amazing. I really couldn't single anybody out as they have been so good - every single one of them.  
When it comes to communication with staff it has been good. They also have a good attitude - they are never rude and are always very quick to help when you need it.  
The ward itself has been both clean and comfortable - I couldn't ask for better. When it comes to the food I have absolutely no complaints - it has been good enough for me.  
I really cannot think of any suggestions for improvement.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: doradoct34
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good care but some ideas for improvement
body:
I had an epileptic fit on Monday, roughly 3 years after I was knocked over. I had been out with a friend, doing some messages, when he said I looked a bit pale and I should see a GP. I knew I couldn’t just walk into my GP so I tried to get an ambulance up to the hospital. When that was not possible I phoned a taxi to take me to the hospital. I then collapsed and began fitting outside the ED.  
I was admitted to the ED and then on up to the ward. All the staff have been helpful and friendly. The nurses are both pleasant, efficient and kind. All the nurses are compassionate and kind. I have enjoyed the ward environment and the entire place is very clean.  
My only issues have been that some patients can be quite disruptive and this can be very unsettling for myself and other patients. I think it would be beneficial to everyone for there to be a ward for sick people who are also dealing with mental health issues or addiction, with specially trained mental health nurses, alongside the medical nurses, allowing those patients to get the care they need and deserve from the hospital. It would also help other patients in the hospital as well

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Medical Form Completion Request From A Doctor
body:
This is my Surgery that I am registered to. I have an offer of employment from a job that requires a medical form completing by a Doctor. The form needed completing within 2 weeks, otherwise I cannot start new employment with the company as I need to go through company Human Resources to review the information provided. I appreciate this is an out of hours service, but I was told up to 8 weeks wait for a form to be completed and you have to pay for this service. I think this is a terrible response from the practice. I have now been forced to seek a private doctor who needs to see my own medical records so have then had to request this from the practice. They don't seem to care that in this climate you could lose an offer of employment. Their lack of help and empathy in this situation is absolutely zero. I hope they are never in this position where they require assistance of this nature from a service. I rang the practice on 4 separate occasions to explain the situation and you can tell your pleas are falling on deaf ears. I even spoke with the practice manager who really couldn't care less either.

If your thinking of registering here, i really wouldn't bother. You would probably be waiting 8 weeks for your registration forms to be completed.

title: Minor Op
body:
After two long waits on the phone, managed to secure a telephone appointment with a Consultant the following day. Was seen in person within a week for further examination and booked in for a minor op the following week which I unfortunately had to cancel. Was rebooked a week later and the procedure was carried out successfully at the Medical Centre.
Although the initial booking of an appointment was frustrating, every member of staff I dealt with was friendly and professional. 
The doctor who carried out the procedure was excellent; great 'bedside-manner'; explained the procedure and after-care in detail and the result was far better than I expected.
Thank you to all involved, you are proof as to how fortunate we are to have the NHS

title: Superb
body: I emailed the surgery at around 07.45 to explain my condition. I had an email back by around 09.30, triaged before end of day and an appointment made for the following day at 11.00 with a Doctor who as always at Mayfield, or Cherrybrook practice was very helpful by listening and giving  time, compassion and a result. Prompt, efficient and professional service from start to finish, please pass on my thanks to all of the team that help make this happen, from reception through to appointment

title: No respect about my situation
body: I get at hospital at 8pm, I waited for more than 8 hours with foot pain and no attendance, and when they finally called me to consult they said they couldn't do anything and not even a medicine they gave me and they didn't do the x-ray that my gp asked for and they just sent me away without resolve this immense pain.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Utter waste of time and tax payers money
body:
I am 68 blood pressure is sky high and i just want an appointment for medication ,no chance i ring and ring and ring 20 in the queue.
When i do get through after 50 minutes or more I'm told no appointments left  .
I guess i will have to wait for the heart attack and ring 999,utter waist of time with some very rude receptionists .

title: Poor service
body: Don’t usually complain but this is so frustrating. Have to ring at 8am to be placed in a queue to make an appointment. By the time you are answered there aren’t any appointments left. Offered a phone call back later and may or may not be seen. Can’t book appointments in advance. How are we meant to see a doctor here? Wanted to make an appointment for my elderly mother and was asked for her details twice. Really dissatisfied.

title: Excellent treatment
body:
The treatment was first class but I could hardly make out what the doctor was saying. In fact I would say I didn’t hear 70% of what he said.
He had a face mask on and spoke so softly, almost just a mumble.
This needs to be addressed as I came away no wiser than I went in.
Such a shame as the treatment couldn’t be faulted.
Ps: I do not have any hearing issues so anyone with less than perfect hearing wouldn’t have even understood 30%. Also the 30% was including asking him to repeat what he had said in the first place!

title: Awful Receptions Communication/Response
body:
Hello Team,

Unfortunately many many people complaint about this and still this has not been looked at. Carpenter's Practice Reception is awful in every sense. First of all regarding appointment they have different rules and sounds like that vary from one receptionist to another. I am looking for baby health check up since one week and first guy told me there is no appointment on that day when i called. and  he mentioned there is no concept of advance appointment. He advised me to check every morning sharp 8. Most of the morning calls never go through as you are waiting in queue after 20/25 people even if you start at 8. Today I got through and a lady said there is no appointment and she could have made advance appointment ( contrary to other receptionist ) but there is none in next 3 days. she is not willing to give any appointment for next week too. They don't make any effort to give you some dates even after 3/4 days after you repeatedly ask for. They are rude and they give you unsolicited advice what you should do and what you should not. For example regarding my baby's weight concern she said we don't do weight check. However I constantly asked for doctor's appointment to discuss about baby's health along with weight check. i am still waiting even after a week. This is utter nonsense. Receptions work is to sort out appointment which they fail miserably. They need to go through some training/course how to deal with patients and phone calls.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent nurses but no hot water in toilet
body:
After collapsing I was brought to Daisy Hill Hospital's Emergency Department following a collapse. My experience here was good. I had quite a long wait. However, all the staff were fine and very helpful - I have no complaints.  
I was then transferred up to Coronary Care where I am now. Everything I have to say about here is very positive. The main enemy on the ward is boredom however as there isn't really much to do.  
All the nurses up here are excellent and all the medical staff have been good as well. Every staff member has been brilliant - but the nurses have been particularly good. Every member of staff is excellent at communicating with you - they tell me exactly what I need to know.  
Any food I have eaten has been absolutely superb - and piping hot as well.  
The only issue I have encountered during my stay here is that there is no hot water in the toilet sink. Other than this everything has been good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: millimetereg35
authorRole: the patient
title: Excellent Healthcare
body:
I attended Ealing Hospital for an ultrasound appoint today at 14:40 and was seen by a sonographer named Mahluli.  
He explained what would happen, put me at ease, fully followed IPC guidelines at all stages, answered all my questions, and was highly efficient. The untrasound room itself was clean, well-ordered and airy. The whole appointment process was calming, efficient and professional at a time when patients can be stressed. Thank you

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The ward has been amazing, ED not as much
body:
I have chronic kidney disease, IgA nephropathy I believe is what it’s called. I have been in and out of the hospital over the past 5 years since my diagnosis so I am well experienced. I started to feel unwell last week, and I knew there was no point in coming into the hospital at the weekend. So I phoned my GP after the weekend, who contacted the ED in Daisy Hill. I spent 18 hours sitting in the waiting area in a chair before I was told that my blood results were normal and I was sent home. I was also referred to Belfast as the viral infection had spread to my eyes and they had become all red and swollen. I sat in Belfast for 8 hours and then I was able to go home. I still felt really ill so I went to sleep the second I got home. A few hours later I woke up in absolute agony, I was in tears with the pain. I wasn’t able to put a millimetre of pressure through my feet, which had been sore since the previous week. I had to throw myself off my bed and slide down the stairs in order to be able to phone 999 before I passed out. I was brought back into the hospital and spent 20 hours waiting for a bed down in the ED. I was then finally brought up to the ward and given proper pain relief. Throughout all of this I found that some doctors that I interacted with did not really listen to me. I felt that if I had come in with drugs or alcohol related problems I would have been seen a lot faster. It was infuriating waiting to see a doctor as all they could offer me was paracetamol until I had been seen when I am on morphine at home to help with the pain.  
Since arriving on the ward, the staff have been amazing. They’re totally brilliant. The staff are very kind and caring. The food has been alright since I arrived, it could be a lot better. The food has varied a lot over the past few years. In 2017 it was atrocious, from 2018-2019 the food was amazing. But it has gone downhill again since then, but I know it must be difficult to cook for so many people at once.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: melondt48
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Excellent support and caring and efficient staff
body: My son fell on some barbed wire and cut his chest open. We went straight to A&E and were triaged quickly by a kind, caring and honest nurse. She advised us it could be a long wait but hopefully as its a quick stitch, they might squeeze us in and they did. Excellent support and caring and efficient staff.

readBy.name: NHS Lothian

author: WHAGS
authorRole: the patient
title: Advice provided by reception and more.
body:
Emma deftly guided me through fixing issues with my getting on to Patient Access online.  
This is typical of all those that I have spoken to, on Reception, over the past 10 years; charming, helpful, efficient and delightful.  
Thank you to the Lawson Practice for flawless professional support.

readBy.name: The Lawson Practice
City & Hackney GP Confederation

author: Sharon-M
authorRole: a service user
title: Caradic Hub Altnagelvin
body:
Let me begin:  
We were told by Dads GP to go straight to the Cardiac Hub in Altnagelvin for 2 pm the team were waiting. My dad is 84 years old and for him to have to go and sit in casualty would have been very stressful. To skip Casualty was a big relief.  
I am writing to tell you how grateful I am to Dr Khalil and the Cardiac Team, Michelle, Janette & Andrew who were assigned to my father with his cardiac issues. The competency of the team on the Cardiac Hub was inspiring, and he couldn't have been luckier. I was amazed by the team you have working there. The Cardiac team probably save a lot of lives in a given year, but let me tell you that this life is forever grateful. Your work is so important. In every way. Thank you, we will never forget what you've done for us. To think that this service is on our own door step and let’s not forget it is free. The Cardiac Hub and ward 44 have been outstanding and extremely helpful during an extremely difficult time for me. Thank you so very much for looking after my precious father. You are all so kind, caring and dedicated. Thank you for all the amazing work you do, especially in these difficult times. Dr Khalil you are one of the kindest people I have ever met you never gave up getting everything just right for my dad. You are such an ambassador for the Western Trust. I am sure the Cardiac Hub and Team saved my father’s life. I also want to thank Dr Casey from Eglinton Medical Centre for all her help and time she really is something else when it comes to being a doctor. Dad has improved so much and is happy to be back in his greenhouse and gardens doing what he loves best.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: hydrusby59
authorRole: the patient
title: Radiology
body:
I attended radiology for a CT scan following a letter which raised concerns for me.  
On arrival I was called quickly by the a radiologist. Whilst she was polite, she failed to tell me what the procedure would involve and just told me to lie down. Naturally I was extremely worried about the scan and after it finished I asked a question but was told they were testing for everything and I would hear from my GP. It was actually my consultant who had referred me.  
I found her to be stand offish and unfriendly. Whilst I appreciate she wasn't going to tell me what she saw she could have used a more empathetic tone and words to try to allay my fears, unfortunately she didn't.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: meloncc43
authorRole: a service user
title: Professional and supportive eye operation
body: I underwent eye surgery in Edinburgh where I was treated by Drs Hughes and Peden assisted by nurses Sarah and Golnaz . I was very nervous but was immediately put at ease and treated in the most professional and supportive way by a team whose ethos was that of excellence .  My thanks and best wishes to all of these valuable members of staff

readBy.name: NHS Lothian

title: mobile request from surgery for feedback on visit
body: Saw nurse for blood test.  Very professional, went through medication and queried if taking.  Did not feel needle at all, careful with patient, answered any queries and questions.  Very good

title: Amazing Staff and Manager
body:
Just terrific...I was emotionally upset at the thought of Mum going to a care home but Staff have looked after me as much as they have Mum since she arrived there. 

There is exceptional care given here and a buoyant atmosphere.

I am so glad we found Wilton Manor.

author: perseusst65
authorRole: the patient
title: Infected spider bite
body:
I was bitten on my leg around a week ago by what we think was probably a spider. Within a week it was getting more swollen, painful and hot and the infection was spreading from the site of the bite. 

I looked online at the NHS 111, answered some questions and it said to go to my local minor injuries clinic. I went along to the UTC department at St Mary’s in Newport and the receptionist, nurse and Dr were all friendly, efficient and sorted me out with antibiotics very quickly.

Thank you

readBy.name: Healthwatch Isle of Wight

author: Bobbyshazzler
authorRole: a service user
title: She loves to see the girls every week
body: I went to this course for the entire duration of the programme, the aim of the course is to help you understand you baby by becoming a ‘baby expert’. As a nervous first time mum I was willing to give the course a go to see what it was like. The course was ran in the spectrum center in the shankill, this meant a 30/40 min journey on 2 buses every Tuesday. This class taught me how to interpret what my baby was telling me and how to become more confident as a mum. Not only was the teaching element of the class helpful, seeing Jayne, Zoley and Angela every week became a great comfort to me. I knew if I ever had a question I could either wait to ask them at my class or text them, they have really supported me throughout my babies early months of life and I feel I have became a better mum because it. I also have enjoyed how much group discussions there was and knowing other mums had the same feelings and worries as myself made everything so much better for me. I honestly think I have been so lucky to have been included in this class and the opportunity should be open to all mums. I really hope they have other classes available for my baby as she grows as it will help me cope with different stages of life with her, and she loves to see the girls every week and will miss them much as myself, a lot when the classes finish up.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything is going smoothly
body:
Accident and emergency was very stressful, the wait was the longest though. Everything was happening at once and I did not know what was happening. They told me certain things that were happening, but other times stuff was done and there was not a reason behind it. It did not bother me at the same time as I was just hoping to get better soon.  
Female Medical is fine, everything is going smoothly, and I am starting to feel better. The food has been okay, I am constantly full with the amount they give out in each portion. The environment is fine but can be either too warm or too cold but they cannot acclimatise everyone.  
The staff are very kind here, they want the best for you. I like the way they have the craic with you while they are checking up, it makes you feel like a person. They explain everything to me until I understand and allow me to ask all the questions I need, although I feel bad asking so many questions since I know they are so busy. I am very happy in this ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very good
body: I have no complaints about the practice however I had an op and follow up at St George's Tooting, the follow up was three weeks ago and my wounds have been dressed twice a week since then by Cranleigh Medical Practice and the service has been excellent. The problem is that the letter from St George's is not on the Cranleigh computer system. Whether this is because they have not received it or have the letter and have not added it to the system I don't know. I could email a copy of the letter as it was forwarded to me by St George's but I can not find an email address for the Cranleigh medical practice.

title: The GP’s are excellent.
body: Further to my review of the 3/8, I had a telephone appointment with one of the GP’s here which was excellent. I had never spoken/scene this GP before, but I was so impressed that he had read my medical history, he listened to me, understood me and wants, issues and needs. He gave great advice, so good. He had to check a few thinks but called me back quickly. I am very pleased. I guess the moral is bite your lip getting past the support staff as the GP’s are excellent.

author: omegany55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good support from care home
body:
From the time I was told I was going to be discharged on the Friday morning, it turned out there was a 36 hour wait. The delay was due to the hospital and the trust delivering the mattress. The care home was ready from the Friday morning for me. I couldn't find fault with the admission into here.  
The admission was good - they were here to welcome me in and as I cannot walk the transfer to the lift and up to my room was very well done. I was made comfortable. I had the choice of sitting up in the chair or of going to bed. I was given a cup of tea and a snack which was what I badly needed. The nurses are good, the carers are good.  
The food is excellent, it is always warm. The staff are friendly and attentive, and are a good support with the Steady which is vital for transporting me. The room and decor is clean and tidy and kept clean.

readBy.name: Public Health Agency

author: waltzts68
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Settling in
body: It is a lovely room. I am content and feel safe. The room is comfortable and I have my paintings on the wall. I can sit in the conservatory and look at the sea. The food is very nice and tasty.

readBy.name: Public Health Agency

author: carinahx63
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Comfortable and content
body: It was nice coming here. It is homely here and the girls are lovely. The food is lovely. The staff are very pleasant.

readBy.name: Public Health Agency

author: Lovecockapoo18
authorRole: a relative
title: My mother
body:
My father, who had prostate cancer, died in January 2022 leaving my mother on her own. She has vascular dementia and this has been worsening recently. Libby attended at my mother’s house to carry out review and I attended too. This is the first time I felt I was supported in any way. Libby highlighted services available to us as we were totally unaware of any help and no one had ever mentioned anything to us. We have had a bad experience with social care services in the past and with the assistance of Libby’s intervention, this has improved considerably to the point that I feel I can relax knowing that my mother is being cared for well.  
Things have improved so much that I have felt confident to return to work and have been able to go on holiday with my own family, knowing that my mum is safe. Being advised that day care is eventually reopening is also helping as my mother is wandering due to boredom.  
Dementia Scotland have been of no use as, although they have a timetable of activities available for my mother to attend, they do not have a transport service for mum as she cannot go on her own as we all work.  
Buddi service has been working well although GPS signal drops often and it worries me that my mum could be quite a distance away before it picks up the signal. Still better with Buddi than without.  
I haven’t utilised the respite care or services available to me yet.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: greenleaves20
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Home from home
body:
Originally I was in the hospital and it was arranged for me to come to here for a short period. I came into the home and was made very welcome. The owner and the staff were very positive as to how I would find it here. It took me a while to accept that I was no longer living at home and no longer as independent as I previously was.  
My mobility is not so good and I am very dependent now on people looking after me, that causes me frustration as I feel I should be able to do the things I used to be able to do. I love it here, the owner especially as she is a very caring person, as are all the staff. It is a very homely place. You never think of getting old and having to go into a care home. Time is short - make life to be as interesting as one can.

readBy.name: Public Health Agency

title: Phone call on time and helpful
body: I was offered a face to face appointment but time not convenient. Earlier phone call instead. On time and helpful.

title: Never any booking
body: I’ve been trying to book an appointment face to face for a week and still nothing ? It’s always busy and fully booked I called over 100 times from 8.40 to 9am for them to tell me it’s fully booked. I need to get checked I’ve been sick for over a month I keep getting referred to different practices I’m so tired. the A&E is rubbish and so are the GP. I think once you die that’s when they will care

title: Fantastic care today
body: I had a coil change today and the doctor (can't remember her name) and health care assistant were both so attentive and caring. Just what I needed when feeling a bit nervous.

title: Used to be good
body: I was very happy with this practice when I first moved to Ashford. However, post pandemic, it is impossible to get an appointment tobseenyour GP. Haven't been able to get an appointment for nearly a year now for any of my family. Regularly end up using out of hours doctors or William Harvey urgent care as its the only way I can get to see a GP

author: victorkb79
authorRole: the patient
title: Phone appointment
body: My phone call with my doctor was very helpful and informative. I was listened to and given reassurance.

readBy.name: City & Hackney GP Confederation
The Lawson Practice

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: Reception staff have poor attitude and often give out inaccurate advice. Takes on average an hour on hold to actually speak to anyone. System update causing unexplained delays in prescriptions too.

title: Start treating patients as humans!
body:
Precisely 10 minutes late for an appointment and the nurse wouldn’t see me. They spent 1 minute lecturing me on wearing a mask but no prior notification was given that masks were still mandatory. Thus adding a minute to the 10 minutes. 

This surgery needs to start treating patients like human beings and not numbers or figures. I waited weeks for this appointments, an unacceptable length of wait in itself... also as a mother it’s not easy to get away from your children to attend appointments. Have some compassion!

title: The worst that Swadlincote has to offer
body: A surgery that never fails to disappoint on every level. Seeing or accessing a doctor at this practice is impossible.

title: Incompetence
body: Absolute joke of a surgery, my husband was promised over 4 weeks ago for important medical documents to be signed. We called every week to be told it would be done, only to find out it hadn't. We were even told one time the GP would call us, but they didn't bother. I work another GP practice, I'm shocked at the level of incompetence and management of expectations. I wish I could give this a negative star review, but unfortunately this isn't possible.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Incredibly lovely staff
body:
My care has been going very good so far and I can honestly say I am very happy with everything and that I have been recovering very well so far.  
I am looked after so well in the hospital and have been incredibly impressed by everything that I have seen in the hospital. The nurses have always been incredibly lovely and are always there on hand to make sure that us patients are all okay.  
All the staff in general have been great and are all kind. They have helped me understand everything answering all my questions or queries. I have had no issues at all and am happy with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Past review.
body:
I left a review in February 2021 regarding the fact that I couldn't log on to their system for repeat prescriptions or appointments. Because it said my details didn't match the records ! I have been a patient with the practice since before Peel House was built and it was transferred there. 
I have just received a reply !!  September 2022 ! so what does that say about their system ?

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Treated excellently by staff
body:
My care has been absolutely excellent so far and I think I have been treated excellently by all the staff they are incredible.  
The nurses have been absolutely great so far and there isn’t a bad word that I could say about a single one of them. They are always so hard working and I appreciate them so much.  
The doctors are also absolutely great and I have been able to understand most of what they say.  
The cleaning and food have been great which has helped leave me with no issue with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The level of care you get here is very good
body:
I have had a good experience so far in the hospital, I cannot complain. Accident and emergency was okay, the staff were lovely and under immense pressure. They checked on me regularly by doing blood pressure and ensured I was okay.  
Female medical is okay, the ward is busy during the day so I cannot get enough quiet to go for a sleep. Another thing that annoys me is the sharing of the TV, not everyone can agree on the channel.  
The staff are nothing but nice here, they try and do their best for everyone. The level of care you get here is very good, I think it is as good as it can get, they are just understaffed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Marvellous Practice
body: Cannot fault this practice. From admin, pharmacy and GPs. Friendly, efficient and easy to contact.I have always had a positive experience with them. They do a great job. I highly recommend this practice.
